column4: i am trying to convert a iso .img and this is what i am typing in
Goodies$ hdiutil convert -format UDRW -o ~/Users/Goodies/ubunutu.img ~/Users/Goodies/Desktop/ubuntu-11.10-desktop-amd64.iso
and it says failed no such directory
what if you run just 'hdiutil' with no args.  Same result?
Correct me if I'm wrong, but isn't hdiutil an OS X program?
mmm...You might see if the graphical Disk Utility will write the image onto the USB stick for you.
2gb per file in my experience.
Ubu can read/write fat32, and read ntfs.  I believe writing to ntfs is also possible, but it will not do this "out of the box".
Disk Utility is also a destructive partitioning tool.  Use gparted to resize nondestructively.
sorry, too many conversations.  Ignore my last statement.
your paths are wrong.
The leading tilde implies your home directory.  You are using a leading tilde, while also speciying a full absolute path.
Try without the tildes.
no leading period either.  Lead with the forward slash.
take out both tildes.
is "Goodies" your username?
I would expect that you will need to follow the guide in order to properly write it to the USB media.
No output means it's doing it's thing.  Wait now for a result when it finishes.
Apple-key == command
http://davespicks.com/writing/programming/mackeys.html
your dd command overwrites the entire device.  Anything you write onto it beforehand is irrelevant.
